S4.T2.caption: Table 2. Graph Construction Throughput(txns/s)
S4.T2.table:
y-s shuffled y-s ordered e-w shuffled e-w ordered
GTX 6727920 4864010 3909976 3946243
Sortledton 4118089 443473 3686403 432638
Teseo 3534455 105234 2609071 24640
LiveGraph 723299 151309 603040 102398
references:
We run two sets of experiments to show GTX’s high performance. The first experiment constructs real-world power-law graphs with (ordered) and without (shuffled) temporal localities to evaluate each system’s transaction throughput (shown in Table 2). Then, we make each system process update logs with and without temporal localities and concurrently run graph analytics (pagerank(PR) and single source shortest path(SSSP)). We report the transaction throughput and graph analytics latency in Table 3, 4.
The results demonstrate significant advancement in performance of GTX over other systems w.r.t. transcation throughput and analytics workloads.
